sub_topic: The chaotic behavior of the weather system
message_1:
A certain region experiences daily temperature changes represented by the function f(t) = sin(2πt/24), where t is the number of hours since midnight. According to chaos theory, this temperature function contains unpredictable elements that make long-term weather forecasting difficult. 

If the temperature at midnight is 15°C, what will the temperature be at noon the next day? Round your answer to two decimal places.
message_2:
To find the temperature at noon the next day, we need to evaluate the function f(t) at t = 12 hours.

f(12) = sin(2π(12)/24)
f(12) = sin(π)

The sine of π is 0. Therefore, the temperature change at noon is 0°C. Since the temperature at midnight was 15°C, the temperature at noon will also be 15°C.
